var.name: job
var.info:
select calculation to perform. The possible values are:
'f-sum' check the f-sum rule 'nmr' compute the magnetic suscept. and NMR chemical shifts 'g_tensor' compute the EPR g-tensor 'efg' compute the electric field gradients at the nuclei

var.name: prefix
var.info: prefix of files saved by program pw.x

var.name: tmp_dir
var.info: temporary directory where pw.x files resides

var.name: conv_threshold
var.info: convergence threshold for the diagonalization and for the Green's function solver

var.name: q_gipaw
var.info: small vector for long wavelength linear response

var.name: iverbosity
var.info: if iverbosity > 0 print more information in output

var.name: filcurr
var.info: for saving the induced current (valence only)

var.name: filfield
var.info: for saving the induced magnetic field (valence only)

var.name: read_recon_in_paratec_fmt
var.info: for reading reconstruction data from Paratec converted pseudopotentials

dimension.name: file_reconstruction
dimension.info: for each pseudopotential, the file name with reconstruction data

var.name: use_nmr_macroscopic_shape
var.info: correct the chemical shift by taking into account the macroscopic shape of the sample

var.name: nmr_macroscopic_shape(3,3)
var.info: tensor for the macroscopic shape correction

var.name: spline_ps
var.info: interpolate pseudopotentials with cubic splines (better accuracy of the chemical shifts)
